Relieved O'Malley: Pope
'a prisoner in a museum'

Boston Archbishop Sean O'Malley said he was glad to not be chosen pope and happy to get back to Boston, even as he reflected on his satisfaction in having taken part in the conclave that elected Pope Francis. (1:20 p.m.)

Court removes judge from Bulger case

A major win for Bulger defense

A federal appeals court granted a defense request to remove judge Richard Stearns from the trial of accused gangster James "Whitey" Bulger. (11:39 a.m.)

Evolving offense led to Welker move

The New England Patriots parted ways with wide receiver Wes Welker because they felt a new offensive direction was needed in order to win another Super Bowl, Greg Bedard writes. (11:01 a.m.)

Homeless man arrested after falling asleep in Brookline apartment

Evgeniy Dolzhenkov, 41, is accused of breaking into an apartment, then falling asleep on a couch where he was found and later arrested, police said. (11:57 a.m.)

Woman who spit on bus driver sought

MBTA Transit Police are searching for a woman who spit on a bus driver’s face after the driver ejected her from the bus for not paying her fare, police said. (11:45 a.m.)
